java.lang.Object

public class AeXPathHelper
extends java.lang.Object

A helper class for executing XPath expressions.

unwrapXPathValue

public java.lang.Object unwrapXPathValue(java.lang.Object aData)
A version of unwrapXPathValue that does not throw an exception when it fails to select something or when multiple items are selected. This should be called rather than passing "true, true" to the 3-arg version of this method.

Parameters:
aData -
Throws:
AeBpelException

unwrapXPathValue

public java.lang.Object unwrapXPathValue(java.lang.Object aData,
                                         boolean aAllowEmptySelection)
                                  throws AeBpelException
Unwrap an XPath value. If the argument is a java.util.List then the behavior is determined by the passed flags (for empty selection - selection of multiple nodes will cause an exception).

Parameters:
aData -
aAllowEmptySelection -
Throws:
AeBpelException

unwrapXPathValue

private java.lang.Object unwrapXPathValue(java.lang.Object aData,
                                          boolean aAllowEmptySelection,
                                          boolean aAllowMultiSelection)
                                   throws AeBpelException
Unwrap an XPath value. If the argument is a java.util.List then the behavior is determined by the passed flags.

Parameters:
aData - The data to unwrap.
aAllowEmptySelection - If true a empty string is returned for no selection, else an exception is thrown.
aAllowMultiSelection - If true, selecting multiple nodes is allowed, else an exception is thrown.
Throws:
AeBpelException

extractCorrelationPropertyValue

executeXPathExpression

public java.lang.Object executeXPathExpression(java.lang.String aExpr,
                                               java.lang.Object aContext,
                                               org.jaxen.NamespaceContext aNamespaceResolver)
                                        throws AeBpelException
Executes the xpath expression using the contextual information passed in AND the default Jaxen XPathFunctionContext. This should only be used if the XPath expression being executed does not need access to the custom function contexts.

Parameters:
aExpr -
aContext -
aNamespaceResolver -
Throws:
AeBpelException

rethrowFunctionCallException

private void rethrowFunctionCallException(java.lang.String aExpression,
                                          org.jaxen.FunctionCallException aFunctionCallException)
                                   throws AeBpelException
Determines the root cause of a function call exception and rethrows it in the form of a AeBpelException.

Parameters:

aFunctionCallException -
Throws:

convertPropertyResultToSimpleType

private java.lang.Object convertPropertyResultToSimpleType(java.lang.Object aObject,
                                                           AeTypeMapping aTypeMapping,
                                                           javax.xml.namespace.QName aType)
                                                    throws AeBusinessProcessException
Converts the argument to a simple type. If the argument is already a simple type (java.lang.String or java.lang.Number) then it is returned unchanged. If not then we're expecting a dom Element in which case we'll extract the text from the element and return that as our value.

Parameters:
aObject - - if you pass null, you'll get an exception
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException
